text: Juan Pablo Montes Montes (born 26 October 1985 in Sulaco, Yoro, Honduras) is a Honduran football player who currently plays as a defender for F.C. Motagua in the Honduran Liga Nacional.LINA.hn – Castigos impuestos por las Comisiones Regionales de Disciplina – 2010-04-23 ==Club career== Montes started his career at Atlético Olanchano, then had a three year-spell at Victoria. He joined Vida in summer 2011 but was out for the season due to a broken foot.Juan Pablo Montes queda fuera del Apertura - La Prensa Montes moved on to Necaxa in January 2012Necaxa confirma tres refuerzos - La Tribuna and then Platense, changing clubs every season since leaving Victoria. He joined F.C. Motagua for the 2013–14 season,Juan Pablo Montes al Motagua y “Rambo” de León al Real Sociedad - Departamento19 where he has won several championships.Motagua descarta la contratación de Juan Pablo Montes - Diez He was nominated in the Best XI at the 2018 CONCACAF Awards. ==International career== Montes made his debut for Honduras in a January 2013 Copa Centroamericana match against El Salvador. As of February 2015, Montes has earned a total of sixteen caps, scoring twice. ===International goals=== :Scores and results list Honduras' goal tally first. {| class="wikitable" |- ! !! Date !!
